lead_paragraph: Southern California guard Gabe Pruitt, who averaged 16.9 points and was a first-team all-star in the Pacific-10 Conference as a sophomore last season, will be academically ineligible for the fall semester. The Trojans' other backcourt starter last season, the freshman Ryan Francis, was shot and killed May 13 in his hometown of Baton Rouge, La., apparently the unintended victim of a dispute between two men. The 6-foot-4 Pruitt will try to regain his eligibility and rejoin the Trojans in mid-December, about a third of the way through the schedule before conference play begins. Pruitt apologized to his coaches and teammates, saying:
